name: Chicken Wontons in Spicy Chili Sauce
description: Big, beautiful, bossy flavors ahead! Shiitake mushrooms and chicken wontons swim in a brothy flavor-filled sauce and get finished with a swirl of sesame oil and chili crisp on top. Yum!
keywords: chicken wontons, chicken wonton soup, wonton soup
recipeIngredient: one 12-ounce bag frozen wontons (I like the mini chicken cilantro ones from Trader Joe’s or Costco)
1-2 cups chicken broth¬†(depending on how soupy you like it)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1 tablespoon sesame oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms; saut√© until softened and yummy. Add garlic for the last minute or two of saut√©ing.¬†
Add the frozen wontons, chicken broth, and teriyaki sauce. Simmer for 5 minutes, with a lid on, until the wontons are heated through.
Finish with remaining 2 tablespoons sesame oil, chili crisp, and top with sesame seeds and scallions.¬†

review.reviewBody: Excellent! Spicy for sure, but you could always leave out the chili crisp if that‚Äôs not your thing. I gave this to my toddlers before adding that ingredient. I think adding just one cup of broth is plenty. We served ours with the Trader Joe‚Äôs fried veggie rice. Will be making again!

I had one of those nights last night where I wasn't in the mood to cook. I threw this recipe together SO fast. It had so much flavor and couldn't have been easier. I'm definitely keeping this in my back pocket for those nights. It was filling and comforting and pretty healthy!

I am in a very dinner time SOS stage of life and this recipe was just perfect. So fast, easy, and full of flavor.  I just pulled a few of the wontons out for the little one before adding the chili at the end.

I made the vegetarian variation and it was really delicious and easy peasy- thank you! My only tip is that I used 1 cup of broth because it seemed plenty when I made the dish, but when I put away the leftovers, the potstickers absorbed the remaining broth, so next time I‚Äôd use closer to the 2 cups of broth.

Just made this on a Sunday of ‚ÄúI can‚Äôt even‚Äù after running after my toddler all weekend, and in true SOS fashion I didn‚Äôt have wontons or teriyaki sauce üòÖ I subbed frozen potstickers and used the frozen sauce that came with the potstickers with a splash of mirin and honey to flavor the sauce. It was amazing! Def going into rotation as the weather cools down.

This recipe has become my staple and go to! I always have these ingredients handy. 
This is a wonderful recipe to use up random bits and pieces of veg I may have at the end of the week. I follow thw recipe exactly and just swap out the veg for whatever I have on hand.
Tonight I sautee‚Äôd cabbage with garlic then did all the rest exactly the same. DELICIOUS! EVERY! TIME!üòç
This is a really great weeknight dinner.  Great taste!  Next time I will use different mushrooms as the shitakes were leathery.  I may have cooked them too long.
This is a really great weeknight dinner.  Great taste!  Next time I will use different mushrooms as the shitakes were leathery.  I may have cooked them too long. Made with potstickers from Costco.

So good and so easy! We made this for dinner tonight. I can‚Äôt believe how good and easy it was! It took me a few stores to find chili crisp, but glad I didn‚Äôt give up.  This will go 8 to our regular rotation!
Delicious recipe and sooo easy! I threw in a dollop of natural peanut butter and crushed peanuts on top for a spicy peanut flavour! Will make these often. Thank you!!!
Have made this 3x in the last week! Obsessed would be putting it lightly.

Loved this dish from the SOS series! I used vegan dumplings and veggie broth, and I put a small side of rice in each bowl to mop up some of the sauce. The meal came together in about 15 minutes. Delicious!
Oops meant to give it that five star rating too!
Another POY winner! The sauce is divine!

I was so excited when I saw this recipe posted because I had the TJ‚Äôs wontons in my freezer and hadn‚Äôt tried them out yet or have any ideas on how I would prepare them. The only ingredients I needed to buy were the mushrooms. Sauces and other veggies were already on hand. This meal did not disappoint with its flavor and ease of preparation. Will def be making these many more times!
